author: bridge-bot
content:
<vdWijden> Could we get a gauge with the versions here: https://grafana.observability.ethpandaops.io/d/feo4ronhsqv40d/opcodes-benchmarking?orgId=1&from=now-3h&to=now&timezone=browser&var-posgreSQL=benuragv7iuwwb&var-ClientName=$__all&var-TestTitle=$__all&refresh=auto
So that we could see when a new version was used. I recently updated ours and I'm not sure if it was picked up correctly. The performance-modexp was picked up and it showed a significant improvement, but I don't see any change on the normal benchmarks

author: bridge-bot
content:
<parithoshj> re: **@vdWijden**
> Could we get a gauge with the versions here: https://grafana.observability.ethpandaops.io/d/feo4ronhsqv40d/opcodes-benchmarking?orgId=1&from=now-3h&to=now&timezone=browser&var-posgreSQL=benuragv7iuwwb&var-ClientName=$__all&var-TestTitle=$__all&refresh=auto
So that we could see when a new version was used. I recently updated ours and I'm not sure if it was picked up correctly. The performance-modexp was picked up and it showed a significant improvement, but I don't see any change on the normal benchmarks
do you want to test gotti's changes or something else? 

because gotti's changes needs a fork (felix's) to be built and run. Since it was a one-off change to the dockerfile and not the final release approach, i ad-hoc built and pushed it to the `performance` tag on dockerhub so that the benchmarker picks it up. Any future pushes to that branch basically overrides this one time test.

author: bridge-bot
content: <parithoshj> i can modify the builder to point to a new source, but i need to know what that source is

author: bridge-bot
content: <vdWijden> Gottis changes are in master now

author: bridge-bot
content: <vdWijden> Seems like they have been picked up after ~4 days

author: bridge-bot
content:
<parithoshj> re: **@vdWijden**
> Gottis changes are in master now
aren't gotti's changes to the go modexp stuff?

```
# Get Go fork and build it.
RUN git clone --branch modexpfix https://github.com/GottfriedHerold/go-modexp /go-modexp```


i.e, this dockerfile: https://github.com/fjl/go-ethereum/blob/modexp-docker/Dockerfile.modexp

I dont see this change on geth master

author: bridge-bot
content: <parithoshj> oh nice! could you backport the required changes to these two branches? then it'll autopick up as expected:

author: bridge-bot
content: <vdWijden> Thats what I'm saying. I backported on Friday and it wasn't picked up until today

author: bridge-bot
content: <vdWijden> (Well perf-modexp was picked up almost immediately)

author: bridge-bot
content: <parithoshj> There's a table at the bottom that should be the info you need. I dont see any immediate fails in the builder that would explain a delay, but let me know if it happens again and i can look into it!
